name: Ridha Mahmood
title: B.S. Computer Science student | Software Engineering Minor

certifications: Google: Using Python to Interact with the Operating System (2025)

bullets: Assisted and maintained Microsoft Power Automate workflows for invoice intake/approvals, automating multi-step routing and exception handling reducing manual touches by 50%.
Scripted automation integrated with Microsoft Dynamics NAV and Excel (VBA) to validate data, remove duplicate entries, and generate audit-ready reconciliation reports.
Operated VM-based processing jobs and authored runbooks/failover procedures to ensure reliable, scalable workflows during peak volume.
Audited and reconciled vendor accounts in QuickBooks/Excel, documenting discrepancies for remediation.
Streamlined monthly reporting by simplifying data pipelines and cleansing inputs for repeatable runs.
Assisted with secure workflow documentation and small data migrations.

projects.name: Ridha-GPT (Personal Résumé Assistant)
details: Built a ChatGPT-style, purple-themed web app that answers questions about my résumé in full sentences.
Implements retrieval-augmented generation over a structured resume.json so answers stay grounded; if info is missing it responds, “I cannot confirm this from my resume.”
Frontend runs on Vite + React; serverless API uses Netlify Functions to call OpenAI securely without exposing the API key.

projects.name: Python Discord Bot
details: Developed a modular Cog-based bot implementing !ping, !roll, and per-server TODOs with SQLite persistence and dotenv-managed secrets.
Added CI/CD (GitHub Actions), PyTest unit tests, structured logging/error handling, and Docker containerization for reliable, reproducible deployments.

projects.name: AI Accessibility Website — Web Design Project
details: Designed and shipped a responsive site for low-vision users with WCAG 2.1 semantics (ARIA roles, alt text) and keyboard-only navigation for screen-reader compatibility.
Integrated automated accessibility checks (Lighthouse/axe) into CI and fixed contrast/heading issues, validating changes with light usability testing.
